page.title: 14Burrowbeck Estate: Housing
page.content: Burrowbeck, an estate in the suburbs of Lancaster, consists of about 150 houses, all built in the last 10 years. There are a lot of detached and semi-detached houses, all of modern design with a lot of glass. Up on a hill there are a few small blocks of flats with three storeys. The estate has been built on farm land and there are still fields to build on. Bailrigg village still has houses being built although there are a few old houses as well. The village is a dead-end. The most peculiar house in the village has a flat roof and was built in the 1930s and is white. At the university all the students live in blocks of flats. Among these modern buildings there is a Tudor house, called Bailrigg House which was private, but is now the medical centre for the University.
